topic: The Nature of Economic Theory II

questions.text: In the process of economic inquiry, the stage where a researcher suggests a tentative answer to explain observed facts by discovering their orderliness is known as:
the first steps in formulating economics theory is
options: using the laws of demands and supply as a graphical representation

questions.text: .................... is used as a synonym for a theory,
.................... it may refer to a particular subset of theories
Which of the following best describes a model in the context of theories?
options: A broad, general explanation of how the world works
A preliminary idea or hunch that needs further testing
A specific quantitative formulation of a theory

questions.text: Which of the following are the main purposes for which a model is built?
What does prediction imply in the context of economics?
options: Forecasting the effects of changes in the economy
Explaining the behaviour of economic units
Deriving laws from a set of assumptions

questions.text: Which of the following is implied by analysis in the context of economic units?
options: Describing and explaining the behaviour of consumers and producers
Forecasting the effects of changes in the economy
Predicting the imposition of a tax on sales

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a criterion for judging the validity of a model?
Which of the following best describes the false-cause fallacy?
options: Assuming that event A caused event B simply because they occurred together.
Establishing causality between two events based on statistical correlation.
Assuming that event A caused event B because event A precedes event B.

questions.text: Which of the following best illustrates the fallacy of composition?
options: Assuming that because a team is made up of talented individuals, the team will be successful.
Assuming that because a company is successful, each employee is highly skilled.
Assuming that because one bad apple spoils the barrel, one good apple will fix the barrel.

questions.text: Which of the following describes the ceteris paribus fallacy?
options: Incorrectly attributing the effect of changes in one set of variables to another set of variables.
Assuming that changes in one variable do not affect other variables.
Failing to consider all relevant variables when analyzing a situation.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the focus of positive science, according to Friedman?
options: Developing theories that predict unobserved phenomena
Finding common characteristics of economic events
Studying economic phenomena as they exist

questions.text: Which of the following best describes normative economics?
options: It deals with the ideal world and what should happen
It examines real economic events from a moral and ethical perspective.
It involves value judgments based on societal aspirations.
